Class BirthdayParadox

java.lang.Object
  BirthdayParadox

public class BirthdayParadox
extends java.lang.Object

The class BirthdayParadox is used to simulated the so-called Birthday paradox, and uses the class Statistics to store the results of the experiments.

Method Detail

runExperiments

public static Statistics runExperiments(int range,
                                        int numberOfRuns)
Runs the series of experiments, and stores the result into a Statistics object

Parameters:
range - the size of the set from which random number are drawn
numberOfRuns - the number of experiments to run
Returns:
a reference to a Statistics instance that holds the result of the experiment

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main method. The default size of the set is 365, and the experiment is run 50 times. Both numbers can be reset from the command line. This method runs the experiments and prints the resulting Statistics

Parameters:
args - if not empty, contains the runtime values for the size of the set and the number of runs
